alert.note: Alert for Clay; Leslie; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 9:52AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Leslie, central Perry and east central Clay Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 951 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hosea, or near Hyden, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Thousandsticks around 955 AM EDT. Hyden, Kaliopi, Wendover, Shoal and Cinda around 1000 AM EDT. Dryhill, Toulouse, Wooton, Confluence, Smilax and Buckhorn Lake S.P. around 1005 AM EDT. Avawam, Mosley Bend, Krypton and Frew around 1010 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hazard, Diablock, Lamont and Chavies. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
